de.tud.kom.p2psim.overlay.bt
Class BTPeerDistributeNode

java.lang.Object
  de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.overlay.AbstractOverlayNode
      de.tud.kom.p2psim.overlay.bt.BTPeerDistributeNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component, ComponentEventListener, ConnectivityListener, OperationCallback, SupportOperations, DistributionStrategy, OverlayNode, TransMessageListener
public class BTPeerDistributeNode
extends AbstractOverlayNode
implements TransMessageListener, DistributionStrategy

This class is responsible for the communication with other peers. It has methods to start a download, upload and it receives most types of the messages from other peers.

Author:
Jan Stolzenburg

downloadDocument

public int downloadDocument(OverlayKey theOverlayKey,
                            java.util.List<TransInfo> theOtherPeers,
                            OperationCallback theCallback)
This method starts a download by creating and activating a download operation.

Specified by:
downloadDocument in interface DistributionStrategy
Parameters:
theOverlayKey - the key/hash of the document that we want to download.
theOtherPeers - a list of peers start also participate in this torrent. We normaly get this list from the tracker.
theCallback - - callback for this operation
Returns:
the operation id of the started download operation.

setContentStorage

public void setContentStorage(ContentStorage theContentStorage)

messageArrived

public void messageArrived(TransMsgEvent theMessageEvent)
Most types of P2P messages in BitTorrent are no direct replies. They are all received by this method. It casts them to a subtype and forwards them to the message handler.

Specified by:
messageArrived in interface TransMessageListener
Parameters:
theMessageEvent - the message event that is received.

createOperation

public Operation createOperation(java.lang.String opName,
                                 java.lang.String[] params,
                                 OperationCallback caller)
Description copied from interface: SupportOperations
Create an appropriate Operation. The component checks whether it can create an operation with the given name and number of parameters. This method is used only to specify operations via configuration (action) files.

Specified by:
createOperation in interface SupportOperations
Parameters:
opName - - operation name
params - - operation parameters if required.
caller - - caller Object which will be informed when the operation finishes (successfully or with a failure)
Returns:
operation - created (can be scheduled or executed immediately)
